ResourceHeader.Description: Akebono was launched on February 22, 1989, by the Japanese Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) predecessor to investigate magnetospheric phenomena associated with the acceleration of aurotal particles. The initial orbit had apogee/perigee altitudes of 10,482 km and 272 km, and had a 75.1 deg inclination. Its spin vector was sun-pointing and its spin period was 8 sec. It carried a full complement of plasma and energetic particle, electric and magnetic field, and wave detectors. The spacecraft and its instruments are described in J. Geomag. Geoelect. 42, 1990.
